title: Dramatic rescue in Sydney's second kidnapping | 7NEWS
description: A 53-year-old man has been rescued from a property in Dural following a major police operation. The victim was abducted in broad daylight on Tuesday at Mount Pritchard by four men wearing balaclavas, who forced him into a Hyundai hatchback outside a tobacconist. A teenager is now in custody, marking the second kidnapping incident in Sydney within a fortnight. title: Two charged over mistaken identity murder of grandfather | 7NEWS
description: Two men, Daniel Stevens (24) and Gerard Andrews (29), have been charged with the murder and kidnapping of 85-year-old Chris Baghsarian, who was snatched from his North Ryde home on February 13 in a case of mistaken identity. The kidnappers allegedly demanded $50 million ransom from their intended target before realising their error, and Baghsarian's body was found 11 days later near a golf course in Pitt Town. Police indicate these arrests are unlikely to be the last, as they continue investigating others potentially involved in ordering the kidnapping. title: Greg Lynn's bail decision delayed a week | 7NEWS
description: Greg Lynn, the accused high country killer and former Jetstar pilot, has appeared at Melbourne Supreme Court seeking bail while awaiting a retrial over the murder of Carol Clay. Three Court of Appeal judges previously ruled he suffered a substantial miscarriage of justice. The Supreme Court judge has delayed the bail decision until Thursday next week, with the court hearing Lynn would live with his son if released into the community. title: Major banks forecast May interest rate hike | 7NEWS
description: Three of Australia's major banksâ€”Commonwealth Bank, NAB, and Westpacâ€”are forecasting the Reserve Bank will increase the official cash rate by 0.25 basis points in May, following inflation figures that rose to 3.4% for the 12 months to January. Reserve Bank Governor Michele Bullock has urged Australians to be patient as the nation deals with persistent inflation above the target of 3%, while federal parliament debates whether government or private spending is driving the inflationary pressure. Australian government debt is set to reach the trillion-dollar mark next month, with the Prime Minister directing ministers to cut spending in the upcoming May budget. title: Australia launches new AusAlert emergency system | 7NEWS
description: Australia is launching a new national emergency alerts system called AusAlert to warn citizens about natural disasters. The system will begin community testing in June, followed by a nationwide test on 27 July where all compatible mobile devices will receive an alert. AusAlert is scheduled to be fully operational by October, ahead of the summer bushfire and cyclone season. title: Arson investigation into Kedron unit fire | 7NEWS
description: A two-storey unit block in Kedron, Brisbane's north, was destroyed by a major fire that erupted around 7.45pm, forcing dozens of residents to evacuate. Firefighters successfully contained the blaze and prevented it from spreading to neighbouring properties, with no injuries reported. Police are investigating whether the fire was deliberately lit. title: Australian Olympians promote LA 2028 at SoFi Stadium | 7NEWS
description: The Australian Olympic Committee is promoting the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics at SoFi Stadium, which will host the opening ceremony and be transformed into an Olympic pool venue with capacity for nearly 40,000 spectators. Olympic legends Ian Thorpe, Michael Klim, and Emma McKeon are encouraging the next generation of swimmers to train for both the LA Games and the 2032 Brisbane Olympics. Australia is building on momentum from its best-ever Winter Olympics performance. title: Oxford Street Mardi Gras route gains national heritage status | 7NEWS
description: A two-kilometre stretch of Sydney's Oxford Street, the centre of the Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade, has been added to the National Heritage Register. The listing traces both the original 1978 protest route and the current parade path from Hyde Park to Moore Park. The designation protects the route under national environmental law and represents one of Australia's highest heritage honours, with the 48th annual parade scheduled for Saturday night. title: King Charles named in explosive Epstein files | 7NEWS
description: King Charles has been named in newly released documents from the Epstein files, with emails from the convicted sex offender claiming Charles was responsible for Prince Andrew losing his position as trade envoy. Biographer Andrew Lownie, author of 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York', alleges the King has been complicit in a cover-up and was involved in the Â£12 million settlement with Virginia Giuffre. Lownie believes the King's position is untenable and suggests he may be forced to abdicate, calling for legal investigation into the matter. title: Bill Gates apologises for Epstein connections | 7NEWS
description: Bill Gates has apologised to staff at the Gates Foundation over his past association with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, calling the meetings a 'huge mistake'. The Microsoft co-founder also admitted to having two affairs with Russian women whilst married to his ex-wife Melinda. Gates maintains he did not involve himself in illegal activities with Epstein and never saw anything illicit. title: Two more ISIS brides held in isolation in Syrian camp | 7NEWS
description: Two additional ISIS brides are being held in isolation at Syria's Roj refugee camp, classified as extremists and separated from the main group of 11 women and 23 children seeking repatriation to Australia. The pair are not Australian citizens but married Australian ISIS fighters. Kurdish authorities have brought forward the camp's closure while the Australian government maintains it will not assist in repatriation efforts, despite being legally obligated to issue passports, creating a political stalemate. title: Optus reveals changes after deadly triple zero outage | 7NEWS
description: Optus is revealing sweeping changes to its operations and culture following a catastrophic triple zero outage that resulted in at least two deaths. CEO Stephen Rue is fronting a parliamentary hearing in Canberra, alongside representatives from Google, Apple, and emergency officials. The telecommunications giant faces scrutiny over the deadly communications meltdown that prevented emergency calls from being connected. title: First home buyers facing longer deposit savings timeline | 7NEWS
description: First home buyers across Australia face widening disparities in deposit saving timelines, with entry-level property prices accelerating nationwide. Sydney buyers now require seven years and seven months to save a 20% house deposit, while Darwin buyers need two years and seven months for an entry-level unit. The gap between the shortest and longest savings timelines continues to expand across different Australian cities. title: Qantas posts profit with frequent flyer overhaul | 7NEWS
description: Qantas has announced a $925 million profit alongside major changes to its frequent flyer program and new seasonal nonstop flights from Sydney to Las Vegas starting December. The airline is introducing status credit rollovers of up to 50%, eliminating points club, and launching an improved reward seat search tool. The airline is also outsourcing hundreds of cabin crew jobs to Singapore while receiving 40 of its 200-plus new aircraft orders, with another 30 arrivals expected in the next 18 months. title: National alerts system AusAlert to roll out later this year
description: AusAlert, Australia's new national alerts system, will roll out later this year in time for next summer, the federal government has announced. #ausalert #alert #emergency #auspol #phone
